page.title: 12Moto Cross
page.content: From{THE COURIER,}14th June 1985. {MOTOR CYCLE SCRAMBLES}have been banned from land at Bells Yew Green for this year at least and possibly a lot longer. {Wealden District Council's planning committee rejected Crowbor- ough{Moto-Cross Club's}application for permission to hold two scrambles a year for five years at{Court Lodge {Down. }While accepting that it was a responsible club whose previous events on the site had been properly run, members feared noise and increased traffic on narrow country lanes. { REPORTED COMMENTS:}They could apply again -{Its howling noise is a severe {nuisance at weekends}- The Council must protect people's peace -{It {channels young men's energies sensibly - There must be more suitable sites - {Muddy roads will be a danger}- It spoils an area of outstanding beauty.
